edu.cmu.sphinx.fst

Class Convert

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.sphinx.fst.Convert

  • public class Convert
extends Object
    Provides the required functionality in order to convert from/to openfst's text format
    Author:
    John Salatas

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void export(Fst fst, String basename)
      Exports an fst to the openfst text format Several files are created as follows: - basename.input.syms - basename.output.syms - basename.fst.txt See OpenFst Quick Tour
      static Fst importFst(String basename, Semiring semiring)
      Imports an openfst text format Several files are imported as follows: - basename.input.syms - basename.output.syms - basename.fst.txt

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • export

        public static void export(Fst fst,
          String basename)
                   throws IOException
        Exports an fst to the openfst text format Several files are created as follows: - basename.input.syms - basename.output.syms - basename.fst.txt See OpenFst Quick Tour
        Parameters:
        fst - the fst to export
        basename - the files' base name
        Throws:
        IOException - IO went wrong

      • importFst

        public static Fst importFst(String basename,
            Semiring semiring)
                     throws NumberFormatException,
                            IOException
        Imports an openfst text format Several files are imported as follows: - basename.input.syms - basename.output.syms - basename.fst.txt
        Parameters:
        basename - the files' base name
        semiring - the fst's semiring
        Returns:
        imported FST
        Throws:
        IOException - IO went wrong
        NumberFormatException - load failed due to data format issues
